hero.description: Designed to align with high-security and regulated environments. Built with privacy-first, offline-capable principles.

founder.title: From the desk of the founder
founder.p1: ZERO was not started to compete with existing platforms. It was started because something fundamental was missing.
founder.p2: Today’s technology landscape prioritizes speed, scale, and growth — often at the cost of privacy, control, and long-term trust. Systems are built to extract data, lock users into subscriptions, and centralize power.
founder.p3_1: I believe privacy should not be a feature you enable.
founder.p3_2: It should be the default state of a system.
founder.name: Shriram Reddy

grid.card1_desc: Data ownership is explicit. ZERO has no access by default. 100% user-owned. No silent collection. Designed for regulated and institutional environments.
grid.card2_desc: Designed to operate in offline and isolated network environments, including air-gapped deployments.
grid.card3_desc: ZERO systems are designed with telemetry disabled by default. Any data collection requires explicit configuration by the operator.
grid.card4_desc: Stop renting your infrastructure. Pay once, deploy forever. Zero vendor lock-in. Procurement friendly.
